meanings.definition: The entrance to a coal mine.
meanings.sent1: The miners gathered at the pithead before descending into the mine.
meanings.sent2: The workers emerged from the pithead covered in coal dust.
meanings.sent3: The pithead was like the mouth of a hungry giant, ready to swallow the miners whole.
meanings.sent4: The pithead stood like a sentinel, guarding the secrets hidden below.
meanings.sent5: The pithead loomed large, a dark portal into the depths of the earth.

meanings.definition: The area at the top of a mine shaft where mining operations take place.
meanings.sent1: The machinery at the pithead hummed with activity as the miners worked below.
meanings.sent2: The pithead was a hive of industry, with carts coming and going constantly.
meanings.sent3: The pithead was like a bustling marketplace, but instead of goods, it dealt in coal.
meanings.sent4: The pithead was the heart of the mine, pumping life into the underground tunnels.
meanings.sent5: The pithead was a stage where the drama of mining unfolded every day.
